inclusion.criterion: male or female, aged 18 to 80 years old
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: urinary incontinence as a result of neurogenic detrusor overactivity for a period of at least 3 months prior to screening
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: stable neurological injury occurring at least 6 months or more
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: detrusor overactivity demonstrated during the screening period or within 1 year of screening
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: negative pregnancy result if female and of childbearing potential
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: experiences at least 14 episodes or more of urinary incontinence per week with no more than 2 incontinent-free days
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: currently uses or is willing to use clean intermittent catheterization (CIC) to empty the bladder
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: history or evidence of any pelvic or urological abnormalities including but not limited to the following: elevated serum creatinine more than 2 times the upper limit of normal (reference range)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: current or history of hematuria, 1) if the hematuria is determined to be a pathologic condition or 2) is uninvestigated
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: interstitial cystitis in the opinion of the investigator bladder stones within 6 months of screening
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: surgery or bladder disease other than detrusor overactivity that may impact bladder function with the exception of surgeries for bladder stones (more than 6 months) and stress incontinence, uterine prolapse, rectocele, or cystocele (more than1year) from screening
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: has had previous or current botulinum toxin therapy within 9 months
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has a history of CVA, neurogenic bladder with indwelling suprapubic catheter and multiple prior admissions for UTIs. They have been treated for urosepsis and have a non-obstructing stone in the L ureter.
